text: To investigate whether the GC-box represents a binding site for the transcription factors <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Sp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , we performed EMSA analyses with nuclear extracts isolated from A3.01 T cells .

As probes , we radioactively labeled the unmodified E2 sequence ( nucleotides -92 / -63 of the <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter , probe designated APO-Sp1 / 3 ) or the same region carrying the two point mutations described above ( probe designated APO-Sp1 / 3mut ) .
As control , we used a commercially available Sp1 consensus oligonucleotide ( Sp1cons ) , which is known to be recognized by <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription factors .
Four DNA-protein complexes were observed in the presence of the APO-Sp1 / 3 probe ( Figure 6A ) .
The upper two complexes were specific since they disappeared in the presence of a 30-fold molar excess of unlabeled APO-Sp1 / 3 probe ( Figure 6A , lane 7 ) .
Further confirmation of the specificity of these DNA-protein complexes was demonstrated by the inability of the unlabeled APO-Sp1 / 3mut probe to abolish binding ( Figure 6A , lanes 12 and 13 ) .
As expected , the two specific complexes were also present in the case of the Sp1cons control probe ( Figure 6A , lanes 2 and 3 ) .
In contrast , none of these specific complexes was observed when the mutated probe was used ( Figure 6A , lanes 10 and 11 ) , confirming that protein binding was dependent on the identified GC-box .

In order to characterize the complexes , we performed supershift experiments using <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - and <extra_id_0> Sp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - specific antibodies .

The upper of the complexes that appeared in combination with the Sp1cons or APO-Sp1 / 3 probes , shifted in the presence of the <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antibody ( Figure 6B , lanes 3 and 7 ) , whereas the lower complex shifted in the presence of the <extra_id_0> Sp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antibody ( Figure 6B , lanes 4 and 8 ) .

Taken together , the EMSA demonstrated that the GC-box located on the <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> core promoter serves as a binding site for <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Sp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: To show binding of <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Sp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> factors also in the context of the endogenous <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter , a chromatin immunoprecipitation ( ChIP ) assay was performed .

text: <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Sp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antibodies , but not an <extra_id_0> actin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antibody , immunoprecipitated the <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter in A3.01 T cells ( Figure 6C , upper panel ) .

In contrast , no PCR signal was received with a primer pair recognizing a region in the <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene ~4000 bp downstream of the Sp1 / Sp3 - binding site ( Figure 6C , lower panel ) .
Only the positive controls showed a DNA band , with an <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression plasmid or the sheared and cross - linked input DNA used as template .

This demonstrates the binding of <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Sp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription factors to the endogenous <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .
